question_sentence: Pope Francis died in April, and his successor was chosen during a conclave at the Vatican. Which country is Pope Leo XIV from?
evidence: Robert Prevost — aka Pope Leo XIV — became the first American pontiff in history.

question_sentence: Which NFL team won Super Bowl LIX in February?
evidence: The Eagles dominated the Chiefs 40-22 to win their second Super Bowl.

question_sentence: Which powerful hurricane devastated several Caribbean islands in October?
evidence: Hurricane Melissa was one of the strongest Atlantic storms in 150 years.

question_sentence: Conservative political activist Charlie Kirk was killed during a campus event in which state?
evidence: Kirk, the co-founder of Turning Point USA, died in a shooting at Utah Valley University.

question_sentence: The federal government shut down in October because of partisan disagreements over spending priorities. How long did the stalemate last?
evidence: The shutdown lasted 43 days — the longest in US history.

question_sentence: Catastrophic flooding swept through a summer camp for girls in which state in July?
evidence: Families of some Camp Mystic flood victims filed lawsuits after 25 girls and two counselors died in the Texas Hill Country.

question_sentence: Wildfires devastated which section of the US in January?
evidence: Powerful winds fueled wildfires that destroyed more than 16,000 structures in Southern California, particularly in the Pacific Palisades area of Los Angeles.

question_sentence: Who was elected mayor of New York City?
evidence: Mamdani made history as the first Muslim to be elected mayor of NYC.

question_sentence: Which movie won best picture at this year’s Academy Awards?
evidence: “Anora,” a dramatic comedy directed by Sean Baker, took home five awards, including best picture and best actress for Mikey Madison.

question_sentence: Sanae Takaichi, a hardline conservative, was elected as the first female prime minister of which country?
evidence: Takaichi, a heavy metal drummer and motorcycle enthusiast, stepped into the role as Japan faces mounting economic woes and fractured politics.

question_sentence: A driver rammed a truck into a crowd of New Year’s revelers, killing 14 people, in which city?
evidence: Dozens more were injured in the terror attack on Bourbon Street in New Orleans.

question_sentence: Tech billionaire Elon Musk was tapped to lead which government agency early in President Donald Trump’s second term?
evidence: Musk led the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and oversaw major cuts to the federal workforce as part of the Trump administration’s efforts to reduce spending.

question_sentence: Which two teams played in this year’s World Series?
evidence: The Los Angeles Dodgers celebrated with a parade after winning the World Series in thrilling fashion over the Toronto Blue Jays.

question_sentence: A passenger jet and US Army helicopter collided near which airport in January, killing 67 people?
evidence: The crash near Washington, DC, was the deadliest aviation disaster in the United States since 2001.

question_sentence: Bryan Kohberger pleaded guilty to killing four students at which university?
evidence: The gruesome crime at the University of Idaho shocked the nation. Kohberger was sentenced to four consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole.

question_sentence: Thieves stole jewels worth more than $100 million from which renowned museum?
evidence: The brazen robbers used a truck-mounted ladder to gain access to the Louvre.

question_sentence: Who was named best new artist at the Grammy Awards?
evidence: Roan is known for campy fashion and hits like “Good Luck, Babe!”

question_sentence: How many House Republicans voted against releasing the Jeffrey Epstein files?
evidence: Rep. Clay Higgins of Louisiana — the only lawmaker to vote against the bipartisan bill to force the release of the Epstein files — said the legislation was written in such a way that it might harm innocent people.

question_sentence: Anna Wintour stepped down as editor-in-chief of which iconic magazine?
evidence: Wintour left her powerful role at Vogue after nearly four decades but stayed on with scaled-back duties.

question_sentence: What is the Oxford Dictionary’s Word of the Year?
evidence: Oxford picked “rage bait” — content deliberately designed to elicit anger in order to increase engagement.
